website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy jack with a high weight capacity, but you may find the wiring installation to be a handful.
pros: Electric jack with a crank manual override
Gears are constructed from hardened steel, while the motor is water-resistant
Has a built-in level and an LED light
cons: Some reports of problems with the wiring that include poor instructions, missing parts, and an unattached ground wire

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: It took no time to install it. It came with very detailed instructions which made the process easy. After I installed I ran it several times with great success. The following weekend I loaded up and headed out of town, I ran the jack a total of three times. When I got home and started to unhook the trailer I ran the jack. I could hear the gear box running but the leg wasn't moving. I had to use the manual crank to get it off. I have no idea what happened between leaving the camp spot and home. I'm going to return it for a replacement, I do like the features....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Poor ground made me pull white ground wire ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Poor ground made me pull white ground wire back through protective cover and attach directly to one of the mounting bolts. Attached breaker switch as instructed and hooked to pos. pole and everything operated as it should. I also found that the jack travels much faster than hand cranking. All said, I am very pleased with purchase and do not expect any problems. ( my hitch wgt is 750pds ).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So glad I did this
customer_reviews.text: So far the jack has worked great. Plenty of power and makes hitch and unhitching so much easier. I have only had this installed for a month and have not gone on any trips yet but will update this review after the summer if there are any issues. It was pretty easy to install. The hardest part was making sure the camper was blocked well enough to take the tongue load. After that - just 3 bolts to unbolt the manual crank jack and the reuse those bolts to bolt on this power jack. Remember to use the washer that comes with the kit so it grounds properly. I then just wired directly to the batter using the inline fuse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this one. It's been reliable and easy to install. Keeps my shoulder from hurting from all that manual cranking you have to eh without it. Makes putting weight distro bars on easy - partially lift the rear of the truck up (not off the ground!) and the bars slide right on. I keep the weather protection bag over the top all the time, hasn't deteriorated in the few years I've had it. I don't take it off for operation, just push the switch through the material. (Just don't turn the light on and leave it on accidentally!) Thanks for a good product! I would never be without one now that I'm spoiled.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: works and clean looking
customer_reviews.text: took 15 mins to install(including removal of old unit) 1 black(positive) 1 white(negative) wires... has redundancy for negative in contact and the white wire. no bolts included packaging is very good for box and Styrofoam speed is maybe 15 % slower then my old unit but there is no bog down 5th star will be added after first trip edit: first trip done 8 uses on my 26 toyhualer with full load 12k.. decent speed,no clicking or popping out. worked solid so 5th star awarded
customer_reviews.author: mark a nicklas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome jack that is simple to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and works great! It isnt really fast, but then again, you dont want it too fast. I found that using the removable pin on the leg and extending it all the way out when taki g off speeds up the process. Then once you lower to hitch you can lift off the ground a couple inches then slide the extension in about 6 inches which speeds up the process. Overall awesome product and beats the heck out of hand cranking!
customer_reviews.author: AZDIYguy13

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment
customer_reviews.text: 1st off I like the fact that my cranking days are over, I hope. Product seems rock solid. Little bit slow but hey it's easier to push a button than crank. Some complain of the noise level. I really don't think it's loud at all. I had researched a lot, and out of seven sites that tested many electric jacks this model ranked #1 on all of them. I have a 2008 Jayco Jayflight 19BH and it not only lifts the tongue with ease but it lifts the rear of my truck as well to easily remove the weight distribution bars. I do recomend JQ-3500B Jack-Black Electric Tongue jack! It's a little power house
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great compact product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install with exception of the wiring instructions. The wiring has two wires and fut box meaning you have to create the circuit with the fuse box in the circuit. However the instruction sent with the jack and on YouTUbe all intruct how to connect with one wire. Finally found a guy on YouTube with same problem I was having "There are two wire, not a split for ground, but two wires." He did great video of wiring this Jack. Company should change the instructions they provide with the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Don Schaaf

customer_reviews.title: Not as loud as the unit it replaced
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily. This replaced a dead power jack that came with my trailer. I did find a youtube video that helped with the installation -- particularly what to do with the white wire. Previous unit had a single red wire connected to a fuse block; this unit has two wires -- red and white -- that are connected directly to the battery terminals. There is an inline fuse on the red line. Unit operates very smoothly and is surprisingly much quieter than the unit it replaced. Speed is fine. Came with a vinyl cover, so no more need for the bucket I was using as a cover :-)
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, recommend getting wire butt connector and ring connector for easiest install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. The instructions were probably more than needed. I didn't think it was that loud, even under load, and it at least as fast as me manually raising and lower the old tongue jack myself. Only used a couple times, but very impressed. Extends a lot further than my old manual jack. The hardest part for me was figuring out the correct wire connectors. I would recommend getting a butt connector and ring connector for the fuse if you don't already have one so you can put it together right away. I used yellow 10 AWG connectors. It would actually be nice if they just sent those with.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Fir perfect and lifter trailer with ease!
customer_reviews.text: The existing lift we had on our trailer decided to start acting up and not be consistent so we purchased this jack after some research on the internet. It fit perfectly, hookup was simple and lifted our Keystone Cougar 30 ft trailer with ease, it is quieter than the old one and just as slow/fast! Best of all, it should work consistently now.
customer_reviews.author: Lancelot

customer_reviews.title: It's cranking the trailer up and down. The instructions ...
customer_reviews.text: It's cranking the trailer up and down. The instructions were worthless, might as well not have them and the light isn't working....but it's lifting the trailer up and down. Guess you get what you pay for! And I can't seem to be able to find a way to contact the seller, so can't address my non working light.
customer_reviews.author: Ivo Pavlov

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job lifting my smallish camper and tow vehicle
customer_reviews.text: Installation instructions could be a bit clearer, but if you have low-level wiring skills you should be able to figure it out. Otherwise, works beautifully, and has some nice lifting power. We have a 23-foot camper and it is easily able to lift it and the attached SUV high enough to allow me to swing over the anti-sway bars on to the hitch (which if you own one of these anti-sway hitches, you know has to be pretty high off the ground). Light lets you know it's switched on. Comes with a little cover for the motor, which keeps it dry. Good product so far for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Great little tongue jack...
customer_reviews.text: Very simple install. Works as described. Sure does beat cranking at a manual tongue jack once arriving at a site or when packing up. Light is a little dinky, not very powerful. But the item does as it describes and lifts the trailer up and down. Five stars if the package included the star washers, battery terminal end, and/or butt connector for connecting the black wire to the fuse line. Had to make a trip to a local auto parts supply store for these items. Also need to save the washer and bolts from the old jack for this install. Otherwise, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JKD Buddha

customer_reviews.title: Good Jack
customer_reviews.text: I received the jack and took it out of the package. The jack was packaged perfectly. Once I saw it I knew that I’d made the best decision. The jack is super easy to install and wire. It came with a circuit breaker rather than a fuse which I love. My only complaint is, there were no mounting bolts included. No big deal ( I was able to reuse the original bolts) I just prefer everything new with a new part. All said, for now I think it’s a good jack at the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Stumpy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome less work to my arms cranking on old manual jack
customer_reviews.text: Came with emergency wrench and cover. Cover is weather proof. Tight spot installing on hybrid where battery tray is as seen on pic. Also comes with bubble not accurately perfect but helps where it is up and down. Ensure follow directions installing. Also make sure have good battery will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Fronty 18

customer_reviews.title: Good OE Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item based solely on the Amazon customer reviews. I was a bit apprehensive about buying a a unit that cost < $120 when a Lippert OE replacement of the same weight rating for my rig was about $225. After 4 uses, I am rather impressed with the performance. This unit is not only a lot quieter than the Lippert, but also noticeably faster. I cannot attest to the durability, but for the price it has been well worth the gamble.
customer_reviews.author: Whitecliffs

customer_reviews.title: Buy  a different jack
customer_reviews.text: Installed the jack on a smaller travel trailer about a month ago. The jack worked fine at the time off the installation. Went to use the jack for the our first trip of the year and the jack raised about 2" and then suddenly stopped. I checked the connections and the inline fuse and both were good so Im guess the motor or switch is broken. Save your money and buy a different jack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money On Dealer-Installed Jacks!!!
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing product at an amazing price! This jack was extremely easy to install. Just hook up your trailer to your tow vehicle, remove the old jack, and bolt this one on. Torque specs (15 - 20 ft lbs) are listed in the manual. Single wire hook-up to the positive terminal of the battery. You will need a short bit of 10 gauge wire (to connect the included in-line circuit breaker), wire connectors, and crimpers. I highly recommend this jack. It works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: LED Light on this product does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I installed my new Jack Quick 3500 Power Tongue Trailer Jack product as per instructions, the jack lift works perfectly, which I am very pleased with, but the LED light will not work which is unacceptable to me. Not sure if the light itself is the issue or if it may be the switch. I cannot give more than two stars for a new product that arrives not working 100 percent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the money
customer_reviews.text: Its been installed just about a year - constantly used, no issues yet. I didnt expect such a decent tongue jack for the price but I have been pleasantly surprised. We have used this in subzero temps with no issues on our 30' V-Nose enclosed trailer loaded. Would HIGHLY recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: DJordan

customer_reviews.title: Nice jack
customer_reviews.text: Really nice jack with simple features. This replaces a fancier brand with a circuit board in it which I would NOT recommend. That circuit board shorted out and then it was toast with no easy way to fix. This has simple toggle switches that you could repair in a pinch if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Doug B.

customer_reviews.title: Jack works great, make sure you have a good battery
customer_reviews.text: I tested this before mounting on my trailer and it worked with no issues. As others have mentioned this is no speed demon. It woks just fine in my opinion. Make sure you have a good battery or batteries. One switch is for the small LED light On/Off. The other switch is to raise/lower the leg. The foot can and should be dropped down when using this jack. This jack met my needs and was very easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Larry H. Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Best money I’ve spent since I bought my camper. As far as noise I would say it’s quite. I don’t know how it could be much quieter and have any power. As far as speed goes, it’s not fast, but it’s a lot faster than me cranking it up by hand, with no cussing or sweating. Makes hooking up the weight distribution hitch a breeze. No tugging, no pry bar needed. I leave the rain cover on all the time, you can work the switch to raise and lower without removing the cover. You would have to remove the cover to use the light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: i used this about 8 times and it quit working, sounds like the gears in it striped out... should be warrenty but cant find a phone number or email to ask about it..
customer_reviews.author: john doel

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install but the instructions suck. The instructions say there is one red wire. Instead there is one red and one white. After looking on the internet I figured it out. The black one is the positive and the white one is the ground. I hooked the white to the negative post and the black to the fuse holder then to the positive post. that fixed it up. I don't know why the instructions couldn't say that.
customer_reviews.author: Randal

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great power Jack! We installed this on our 27 foot camper to replace a faulty one. This product is made to keep water out unlike my other one. Very easy to install and works Great! Has a nice bright light and Came with a nice waterproof cover even! People complain that it's loud and slow but it seems to work faster and more quiet then my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Breigh

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Have owned it for a month, and only camped once, but it seems to be a solid replacement. The leather bag for the top is a nice touch. Make sure you buy the 10 gauge battery connectors and crimp connectors for the fuse ahead of time or you'll be going to lowes mid project
customer_reviews.author: amp381

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 23 ft hybrid trailer, we were tired of hand cranking! It was easy to install. We’ve had it for a year and have had no problems with it. We keep the cover on it when we aren’t using it, to protect it from the elements. We would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Penny W.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my manual crank jack. Install was easier than I thought, and it works exactly the way I hoped. It might be slower than others, but for the price I paid it still beats hand cranking and it fully supports my 19ft travel trailer. I'm completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: loonee2n

customer_reviews.title: Works, but to slow for my application
customer_reviews.text: Works, but slow for my application. Replaced 20amp fuse(x2) in vehicle to 30amp due to runtime. Have it on my Aluminium EX H&H speed-loader car trailer. IMO this is perfect for a camper, slowly raising, so nothing gets dislodged.
customer_reviews.author: B. K

customer_reviews.title: Installed easily, speed and power are both very acceptable
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily, speed and power are both very acceptable. Only issue I had was that I use to be able to open the rear hatchback on my Traverse all the way when I was hooked up to the Camper...now I can only partially open it before it hits the Tongue Jack's Light. Tried to rotate it but the hole layout is not symmetrical, so unfortunately that is not an option without drilling new holes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Light does not work
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed and installed. This was a replacement to my husky. So install was easy but on a brand new product the light does not work. I also noticed that the light switch itself seemed slightly damaged. I’m going to live with it because it’s not worth my time to uninstall and send back. Hope this one lasts longer than the last.
customer_reviews.author: Abhi

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Fit exactly as the old one did, however it is very slow you will be able to watch your beard grow as you wait for it to move. (Gear reduction) Only used it a couple of time but have has no issues with it so far. The attached light is very dim, so I’m sure it would work in complete darkness, it is worthless if any other light is available
customer_reviews.author: JS Ragman

customer_reviews.title: Luckily I read the bad reviews and was able pop off the motor guard ...
customer_reviews.text: Won the lotto and got one with a ground wire not connected. Luckily I read the bad reviews and was able pop off the motor guard to reroute the ground back down next to the power wire to one of the tongue mounting bolts. 30 mins later I have a nice working jack that goes up and down with ease. I'm not a big fan of having to fix something brand new, this company needs better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B

customer_reviews.title: Annoying Manufacture Screw Up
customer_reviews.text: Everything installed easily and I obviously wanted to try it out. I quickly realized the manufacturer installed the up/down toggle switch upside down so up is down and down is up. How in the world does that happen? Makes me question if there are other quality control issues I’m going to find down the road. Now I get to fix their screw up
customer_reviews.author: Marc Petty

customer_reviews.title: Working so far
customer_reviews.text: Of course the instructions are not very clear, but there are videos out there (not from the manufacturer???) on how to install for those that are less electronically inclined. Essentially connect the black wire to one red wire of the reset switch, then connect the other red wire on the switch to the positive side of the battery using a ring terminal connector. I installed it on September 10th and will update if I have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chrazyman

customer_reviews.title: Do not lower to far
customer_reviews.text: A good piece of equipment and sure beats the hand crank. Do be careful not to lower below the mark on the shaft or you will blow the switch. You should keep a few 20A fuses hand for replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Electric Tongue Jack
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. It was easy to install and it works just like it's supposed to. I don't really care about the speed like some seem to have concerns about. When you go from a manual crank to this you'll be glad you did. Very smooth operation and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Complete
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Compact and heavy duty, easy to install. I was impressed with the sheep foot's heavy steel construction. The last company l purchased from wasn't thick metal and it was very loud.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Kimbro

customer_reviews.title: Hardware not included and the service light does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. The light is not working (doesn't justify the hassle of returning it). Does not include mounting hardware. So, if you don't plan on using your existing hardware (mine was heavily rusted) you'll have to go on a search of the correct size and specs. It does seem to be a little slow.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 1 year and now won’t lift my trailer once it gets pressure applied to tha jack. Will never buy from this manufacturer again
customer_reviews.author: Guidoxpress

customer_reviews.title: Good investment, saves the arms.
customer_reviews.text: Jack was a easy replacement compared to a hand crank. Makes hooking up the trailer a breeze. Not sure yet if the little bag that goes over the motor will prevent any issues associated to rain but we’ll see this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Ballard Warkentin

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: i used this on a 32 foot travel trailer weight of 7500 lbs. replaced the old handcrank. very easy to install with the proper tools. most important tool is a 9 ton hydraulic jack to support the trailer while exchanging jacks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome jack
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing, super easy install, not nearly as loud as the videos show, extremely reasonable sound. Only downside is the bubble level on top cracked within a week of putting it on. Not a deal breaker at all, though. Very pleased with this jack.
customer_reviews.author: Quixotic

customer_reviews.title: Slow, but good
customer_reviews.text: I'm now spoiled - no more hand cranking for me. The "extension" is only about 9" which isn't far enough, but okay, I'll stand there holding the switch for another 15 seconds to raise the trailer hitch. I bought a second one for my other trailer. Never going back to hand crank.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of cake
customer_reviews.text: Very easy install. I purchased this because the hand-crank injured my back after parking on a less-than-level surface weeks ago. The old jack came off easily, the holes on the new jack lined up perfectly. Wiring was a cinch. Although it seems to move slowly, it actually travels faster than others I looked at. Would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: PirateBass

customer_reviews.title: Great jack, sub-par level
customer_reviews.text: So the jack went on in about 20 minutes. It took longer to route the wires and make them look nice than it did to actually install the jack. However, after only being on the trailer for two weeks, the little bubble level on top has become non-existent. Apparently, the fluid has leaked out?? It's the cap to the manual crank, so I'm not sure what happened. Quick Products, any chance I can get a new bubble level cap?
customer_reviews.author: Todd Witten

customer_reviews.title: Works, but very slowly
customer_reviews.text: I've had this jack just over 1 year now. Jack that came with the trailer died from the weather getting into it. This one has worked good. It is slow as molasses in January though. That is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: squisheez

customer_reviews.title: Quick Products JQ-3500B Trailer Jack
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product thus far. Took 10 minutes to install. Add your eyelets onto the cables and call it good. Comes with an in-line circuit breaker, work light, and bubble level to check the level of your trailer.
customer_reviews.author: dhart27

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I like this jack. It comes with a nice weather proof bag . The foot is has four adjustable holes which is a real nice feature. It appears to be well built and the cap that covers the manual winder is a bullet level . The jack is easy to crank with the hand crank .once hooked up to power it easly raised and lowered my 24 ft car trailer. The switch for the light and lift switch are well placed at the front of the jack. I cannot speak for the longevity of this jack, if left covered it seems like it should last quite a while.It also comes with a circuit breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I had no issues with this electric jack. Installed easily and is quieter than my original electric Jack which was almost double the price I paid for this one. I would HIGHLY recommend this jack and the company I purchased it from. It came quick and was well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Best replacement jack! I replaced a crank jack on my small RV and this works perfectly. Yes, it’s slow but I don’t care because it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Jack for the $
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that I would improve is the speed rate but not that worried about it. Works great. I would say they need to update the install directions. The unit I got had 2 wires to hook up. When instructions only had one. Which reading up on these is common, self grounded. Well after combing through YouTube videos I found on with the same issue and it ended up being a ground hook up. Bag that comes with it is ok but after it rains i have noticed moisture inside and ontop of the jack.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works excellent
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my hand crank jack off my camper with this bad boy! My only regret is I waited this long to do it. Makes set the camper up so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: I put star washers (came with) under heads of bolts and it grounded fine.
customer_reviews.text: Not slow at all! Comes with protective cover also. Switches have weatherproof covers. Made in China but what isn't! 4 different mount holes for foot. I put star washers (came with) under heads of bolts and it grounded fine.
customer_reviews.author: Doodlebugzz

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack
customer_reviews.text: The Jack seems great on my 1st trip. My trailer is 34' long, so it has a lot of tongue weight, but the jack preformed great, The wiring instructions kinda blow, but I figured it out. I like the built in light and the included cover to keep the dirt out. All in all very happy
customer_reviews.author: Wood

customer_reviews.title: Electric jack
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good quality. We bought and put on a vintage camper we had for sale as the previous one on there decided to quit working the day before new owners picked it up. He was pretty jazzed about the product.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Jack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Jack. Used it all summer and this thing is powerfu and easy to install. Had to do a little cutting to trailer frame but no problem. To attach distribution bars this thing lifts both trailer and van rear as high as needed, about a foot, with NO problem. As good as ones double the price. Get this you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: woodman

customer_reviews.title: Easy install,works great
customer_reviews.text: Saves a lot of effort. You can unhook and level your RV without even having to put your drink down. Could use more instructions on getting the bubble centered on installation but it can be figured out.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Hooks

customer_reviews.title: Easy instal and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. I replaced the jack on my 24 foot toy hauler. It is quiet compared to other jacks I have used and works very well. Some reviews have said that it is slow but I don't agree. This is smooth and lifts my trailer with ease. The motor cover is also a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: perks hotrods

customer_reviews.title: A good Jack and a good price
customer_reviews.text: Power jacks are for folks like me who are either lazy or just don't want to stand there and crank a manual jack. This is mounted on the tongue of a 13' Casita. I added a marine 12V outlet to the trailer side, added a connection to the jack wiring and plug it in when needed. The only downside in my situation is that I can't open the tailgate of my tow vehicle while connected to the trailer. The tailgate would impact the jack motor. So, all you do is unhook before using. A good unit. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The jack it's self works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install works great for our 30ft travel trailer. The level on it broke day 1 and the light on it is very dim but the jack it's self works great
customer_reviews.author: Justin F.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. It’s slow like other reviewers said. It also seems to have a bent shaft. When I’m raising or lowering it the whole thing seems like it flexes like the worm gear isn’t true. It still works.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: If your rv doesn't have an electric jack, you need one. I know I don't hook up and unhook a lot but it is so nice going controlling it with a switch. Easy install. Leveling the trailer was so much easier too. Seems to be a pretty strong jack also
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good for price, adjustable foot is nice to reduce crank up time.
customer_reviews.text: Installed fairly easily. Came with a circuit breaker, I installed that in the battery box on the tongue of the camper as it didn't appear waterproof to leave outside. I didn't care too much for the ground through the mounting bolts as that will corrode eventually, so added a 8 gauge ground wire from a mounting bolt to the battery. LED light on front does not seem too bright.
customer_reviews.author: Smithy

customer_reviews.title: It was super easy to install and is much quieter than the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a new tent Trailer and the power tongue Jack stopped working. Rather than dealing with the hassle of repairing the cheap POS unit that came with my trailer I decided to buy this and install it myself! It was super easy to install and is much quieter than the one I had before. I like how it comes with a waterproof bag to cover it when it's not in use. Great product and great price!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C

customer_reviews.title: I felt like the motor was kind of slow but I guess ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this unit today. Bolted right in with no issues. I felt like the motor was kind of slow but I guess that's ok as long as it gets the job done. There are 2 toggle switches on the unit. Both of mine are missing the nuts to hold them in place. Hopefully Jack Quick will send me a couple otherwise I have to go buy 2 toggle switches at local auto parts store just to get the 2 nuts. We will see how it holds up over time. I did like the protective cover came with.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great jack, great price
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the jack once but it worked great, did everything I expected and then some
customer_reviews.author: Jill M.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to an electric jack and used it for 4 years until we sold the camper. My husband had no problem installing it and it was still working well when we sold the camper.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hemp

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade for my 32 ft camper
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Jack Quick thinking it would make life easier and does it ever! Easy to install and easy to use. Hooked it directly to the ax. battery on my travel trailer and had it working in about 20 minutes. Handles the heavy lifting without a problem. There is a level built into the top of the jack. It has failed after a few months. Upgrading this to 5 star. The level broke on the top and when I let customer service know I had a new one in 2 days!
customer_reviews.author: Randy L. Vickery

customer_reviews.title: Screw cranking!
customer_reviews.text: Why throw your back out, and get all sweaty. Just push a button! Install was straight forward. Works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Gilcrease

customer_reviews.title: Would have given a higher rating except for instructions on ...
customer_reviews.text: Would have given a higher rating except for instructions on wiring Instructions were vague. Mine came with 2 wires 1 black and 1 white. Instructions doesn't say anything about what to do with the white wire. Finally through trial and error got it to work The black connects to the positive (use the red pigtail current breaker) and the white to the negative. With a 2 wire system the star washers are not necessary as the grounding is through the white wire. It works find but I'll weigh in later after using it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes connecting trailer easy.
customer_reviews.text: I added this to a car hauler trailer to make connecting and disconnecting easier.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Jack works, light doesn’t.
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this 4 stars because the light does not work. Not that big a deal but it’s still a flaw. I have yet to open it to see why but after reading a lot of reviews I am going to assume it is an assembly operator error and they forgot to install the bulb, or connect a wire, etc. Once I figure it out I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S

customer_reviews.title: It works just fine on my Starcraft
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a Starcraft SB16. The holes aligned exactly and the unit worked first time. The only complaint I have is that I needed to crimp on a large connector to connect to the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Biff Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Installed on 14K lb Flatbed. Lifts trailer just fine. Time will tell
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy jack, lifts my 14K flatbed just fine. Slow but steady.
customer_reviews.author: obars

customer_reviews.title: Why did I weight so long?
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible. Not sure why I waited so long to buy one. Easy install, although like other reviews state you may need extra components that are not included. In my opinion this is true with all universal fit products
customer_reviews.author: Staycie S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack but lights do not work
customer_reviews.text: The jack seems to be working fine but the light stopped working after 1st use.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy D

customer_reviews.title: Nice jack.
customer_reviews.text: Way nicer than the on that came with camper. Comes with a cover, and can operate jack with the cover on. If you want.
customer_reviews.author: jgmomof2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement
customer_reviews.text: Easy install to replace my broken jack on my RV.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Celec

customer_reviews.title: Cheap no customer service reaching back
customer_reviews.text: I like it haven’t got to use it much. Don’t count on that light working more than once anyway! I wished I would have got a different one seems cheap and I reached out to the company about light no response! I think I will return it. Easy to install little slow but it works definitely not overbuilt lol sometimes you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Sam H.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love this jack. Easy to install. Lifts my trailer plenty fast. Full cycle maybe a minute or two. No slower than hand crank. I wish the fuse were in-line didn't want to drill a hole to mount a fuse. No big deal. Pay attention to marking on fuse housing. Lead end to battery. Load end to jack. Mine came with a nice quality cover and has a level built in. Great value
customer_reviews.author: Steve Goebel

customer_reviews.title: Did the job so far.
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily into the same holes my manual jack used. The jack is a little loud under load. Powerful. Lifted trailer and the back of my truck when attaching the leveling spring bars. Only been on one long trip so far but worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo52

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack
customer_reviews.text: Works good on travel trailer. Great speed and low noise when comparing to the ones that come with trailers now days. Simple install and love having a breaker instead of having to replace a fuse in a pinch. Haven't had to reset the breaker yet.. Will order another if ever needed
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Pushing a button beats hand ranking!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality product - anything to make rving a little easier is great! Quick install and works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: JSB

customer_reviews.title: Great , and price is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I think this is great for the price. It is a little loud, but has made it so much easier for hook up and drop.
customer_reviews.author: Syncope70

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Been installed for a year now no issues, lifts my 23 ft tracer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lukus

customer_reviews.title: Great jack
customer_reviews.text: Great Jack. I keep the cover on it so has not been exposed to the elements. very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and smooth.  Replaced a 10 year old Lippert with this one.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, could have given 5 stars, but the regrettable breaker is not already soldered in.
customer_reviews.author: M. Parr

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Installed super easy. Three bolts out, remove old crank jack, insert jack quick, three bolts in, connect wiring, done. I spent a little more time with wire loom and zip ties to make it look purdy but super happy with it so far. Going on trip this weekend so I'll put it to the test.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits and works perfectly - old jack was "triangular" mounting
customer_reviews.text: My trailer is a 2003 Thor Tahoe 18DT. The previous jack had what I would call a triangular mounting, but these holes line up perfectly. My only concern is that there is no on/off switch for the lift action, so I'm worried about when my 3 year old discovers that the switch does fancy things. There is a second switch that turns on a little white LED that could be very helpful when parking at night.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. StrangeBrew

customer_reviews.title: Wiring question
customer_reviews.text: Just installed my jack with no issues....HOWEVER...there are 2 wires coming from the power head, black and a white wire. I realize the black connects to the + side of the battery. What about the white wire???? HELP
customer_reviews.author: Oscar H.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, save time/effort.
customer_reviews.text: Simple installation, easy to use. Note that you will want to get some terminal loops to make connecting wires to your battery easier/cleaner. I believe the wires were 10ga.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!! It was a gift from my son for my camper! Super easy to use. Was installed by a friend but he didn’t have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install and wire up! Quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Wow this was so easy to install and hook up! Absolutely love it so far. The little light isn't bright at all. A lot of people said that its loud?...not sure where they got that. It's fairly quiet if you ask me. So far I would highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: paul carden

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack
customer_reviews.text: Installed in minutes 1 wire to hook up and worked perfect, it now lift my camper with out issues and don't find it to be any slower than the previous electric jack it replaced
customer_reviews.author: johnrt

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and it works very well. Be a good idea to keep it dry rather than exposed to weather when your not camping
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: i install this jack today it was easy to move it around and wire up to the ...
customer_reviews.text: i install this jack today it was easy to move it around and wire up to the camper battery on my horse trailer bumper-pull i did not think it would fit at first but it just slide in the hole and bolt it down and wire it could not be much easier then that
customer_reviews.author: Brian G. Moser

customer_reviews.title: A few more installation instructions😄
customer_reviews.text: Installation of the jack is a breeze. The wiring however requires you to provide two connectors one to install the in-line fuse to the power line and another to connect the fuse wire to the battery post. The instructions for the fuse are vague. One fuse wire is marked "line"-this side is attached to the power source (battery). The other is marked "load". This is attached to the jacks power line. I wrapped all my connections with electrical tape and tucked them under my battery cover away from the terminals and secure. I am very pleased with the product just wish suppliers paid more attention to providing detailed instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Loopner

product_meta.title: Quick Products JQ-3500B Electric Tongue Jack - Black
product_meta.description: The Quick Products 3500 Electric Tongue Jack boasts a staggering 3,650 lbs. maximum weight capacity and delivers deluxe features at an unbeatable price. The 2.25" diameter outpost fits all 2.25" A-frame trailers and offers 18" of travel for easy attachment to equalizing bars. An LED working light on the front of the jack makes for easy night hookups, while a built-in leveling cap makes it easy to position the trailer tongue height. Beneath the jack housing, you’ll find heavy-duty hardened steel gears and water-resistant electrical components that are built to last. Each Quick Products Jack is backed by our exclusive one-year no-hassle warranty.
feature_bullets: The JQ-3500 electric tongue jack boasts a maximum lift capacity 3,650 lbs.
2.25" post diameter is the standard tongue jack size, making it easy to install into existing jack mounting holes
Water-resistant electrical components and heavy-duty steel gears sit beneath the clean, sleek plastic housing
Each JQ-3500 jack includes a manual crank override, bubble-style leveling cap, LED work light, and a heavy-duty weatherproof vinyl cover

specifications.Cover Included: Quick Products JQ-3500B Electric Tongue Jack - Black
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars773 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
